question:
Given an EL function declared with:
11.
12. spin 13. com.example.Spinner

options.A: 14. <function-signature>15. java.lang.String spinIt()16. </function-signature>17. </function>Which two are true? (Choose two.)
options.B: The function method must have the signature: public String spin().
options.C: The method must be mapped to the logical name “spin” in the web.xml file.
options.D: The function method must have the signature: public String spinIt().
options.E: The function method must have the signature public static String spin().
options.F: The function method must have the signature: public static String spinIt().
options.G: The function class must be named Spinner, and must be in the package com.example.
